result.execSummary:
All charges against Daniel D Powers in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel D Powers is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel D Powers

defendant.name: Powers, Daniel D

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel D Powers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty appeared by video for Daniel D Powers in the RCJ. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Multiple Parents of Victims appears via zoom. Some of the victims are having trouble connecting to zoom. Court is livestreamed and good faith attempts have been made to give notification and compliance with Marcy's Law. Both parties are prepared to proceed.
State moves to dismiss, case is being reissued as 22CF629 with new charges added. 
BTC: Case is dismissed.

***ALSO $50,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. No contact with minor children, anyone under the age 18. No contact with the victims in the complaint.

8:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel D Powers in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Daniel D Powers.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Daniel D Powers. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense has filed a motion to dismiss. 
Court reviews the motion.
Defense argues there is no supporting facts to prove probable cause of sexual contact. Moves to dismiss all three counts.
State does acknowledge count one, plans to file an amended complaint to address this. Argues to counts 2 and 3, requests the Motion to dismiss be denied.
Defense gives further argument on Burden being met. 
BTC: Motion to dismiss is granted on count 1 without prejudice. Motion to dismiss counts 2 and 3 is denied, probable cause is found in the complaint. 

State asks for an adjournment on the preliminary hearing.
Defense objects to the adjournment, is prepared to proceed and would like to address bond. 
Parties proceed with preliminary hearing. 
State calls Investigator A. Willis, DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on cross.
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects, refers to his argument in the MTD on probable cause. 
BTC: Probable cause found, bound over on counts 2 and 3. 
Defense moves to modify bond from cash to a signature bond with argument.
State objects to bond modification with argument.
BTC: Motion to modify bond to a signature bond is denied. Court will modify bond to a $10,000 cash bond and a $50,000 signature bond, same conditions apply- no contact with ANY minor children, and GPS monitoring with only the standard exceptions.
Arraignment scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Atty. Patrick Cafferty and Atty. Carl Johnson are co-counsel in this case.

Adjustment Number: 22A 327353,
Payable Number: 455830,
Receipt Number: 22R 004529F,
Amount: $20.00

9:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel D Powers in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant has retained Attorney Patrick Cafferty, requests an adjournment.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits to allow counsel be present.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
